alert.note: Alert for Dyer; Gibson; Obion (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 11 at 7:49PM CDT until August 14 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Tennessee... Obion River near Obion For the Obion River...including Martin, Obion, Bogota...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Obion River near Obion. * WHEN...Until Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 35.0 feet, several secondary roads and large areas of farmland are flooded in northern Dyer County. Flooding is occurring around Rives in southeast Obion County. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CDT Friday the stage was 34.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 PM CDT Friday was 35.4 feet. - Forecast...The river will continue a gradual fall and is expected to drop below flood stage early Monday morning. - Flood stage is 34.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at weather.gov/memphis. The next statement will be issued as conditions warrant.
